thread.title: White House downplays Biden focus on Clinton vulnerability
thread.title_full: White House downplays Biden focus on Clinton vulnerability | Washington Examiner

author: Nicole Duran
title: White House downplays Biden focus on Clinton vulnerability
text:
White House spokesman Josh Earnest on Monday downplayed the idea that Vice President Joe Biden might enter the 2016 race solely because frontrunner Hillary Clinton appears to be vulnerable on issues of trust.
Earnest said the existence of a good opening isn't a major factor, and said the possibility of putting your family through the rigors of a campaign is a much bigger factor.
"If you are making your decision about whether or not to get in a race based on your perception of someone else's standing in the race, that is not likely to be a useful strategy," Earnest said, indirectly speaking to scuttlebutt that Biden started looking at the race because of Clinton's perceived weaknesses.
Related Story: http://www.washingtonexaminer.com/article/2574118/ "If the reason you are running is that you perceive that someone else is not doing as well as they should, that is not a particularly effective rationale for voters," Earnest said. "You can't be trying to game the system."
  Florida Senate votes to remove Confederate flag from seal The new seal will replace the Confederate flag with the flags of ally nations, including France and Spain.
By Kelly Cohen • 10/19/15 5:31 PM Each candidate must demonstrate his or her own commitment and desire to serve, as well as their vision for the country, Earnest said.
Biden's decision is a "very personal one," and if he finally jumps into the 2016 Democratic primary fray, it will be because he's decided to "re-up" his "profound commitment" to this country, Earnest said.
Earnest wouldn't confirm if Biden might decide in the next two days whether to run, as some reports said is the case, or whether he has told Obama what his plans are.

By Ariel Cohen • 10/19/15 2:28 PM
